ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Some faces on that Day will be downcast,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Many faces will be contrite on that day,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Some faces that Day shall be downcast with fear,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: On that day the faces of some people will be humbly cast down,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Many a face will be disgraced on that day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Some faces that Day will be Khashi`ah.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: (Some) faces on that day shall be downcast,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: On that day (many) faces will be downcast,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: On that Day, there shall be downcast faces,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Faces on that Day shall be downcast,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Some faces on that day will be humbled,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Some faces, that Day, will be humiliated,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Some faces, that Day, will be humiliated (in the Hell-fire, i.e. the faces of all disbelievers, Jews and Christians, etc.).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: On that Day faces shall be humbled,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Faces on that Day will be shamed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [Some] faces, that Day, will be humbled,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [88:2] Some faces on that day — they [faces] are used to represent the individuals in both instances — will be humbled, abject,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (On that day) the Day of Judgement ((many) faces) the faces of the disbelievers and hypocrites (will be downcast) abased because of the chastisement,
